alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Custer; Greer; Harmon; Kiowa; Roger Mills; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:02PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Washita, southeastern Roger Mills, southern Custer, northwestern Kiowa, east central Harmon, Greer and eastern Beckham Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 702 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Arapaho to 3 miles southeast of Dill City to 6 miles south of Granite to 10 miles southwest of Mangum. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elk City, Clinton, Sayre, Hobart, Mangum, Cordell, Granite, Burns Flat, Sentinel, Arapaho, Hammon, Dill City, Canute, Lone Wolf, Custer City, Butler, Carter, Roosevelt, Bessie, and Rocky. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 22 and 77. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Beckham; Custer; Greer; Harmon; Kiowa; Roger Mills; Washita
